results.description:
** Saturday Afternoon Open Play/Clinic Combos**

We now offer, Beginner, Intermediate and occasionally Advanced, Saturday afternoon Combined Open Play/Clinics for the UNBELIEVABLE PRICE of $14.00 for a 3 hr. Session!

An Open Play/Clinic! What’s that?........It is our unique creation! Three hours of Open Play and Clinic combined! Here’s how it works. 3 teams of 8 players each alternate playing games on one of our 2 main courts at Brandeis H.S. (84th st. bet Columbus & Amsterdam) Now get this, while the third team is out, instead of sitting around, that team gets a clinic (8 players to one coach) on our back court at Brandeis with a top instructor. When the two teams finish their game on the main court, one comes off for instruction. Meanwhile, the players that just received instruction take what they just learned and use it in the next game. This rotation continues for 3 hrs! It is a great way to meet new players and improve your skills at the same time.  It is an absolutely unbelievable deal!

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space.

http://nyurban.com/open-play-registration-vb/?filter_id=1&gametypeid=1
results.name: SATURDAY AFTERNOON OPEN PLAY/CLINIC (Beginner/Adv Beg & Intermediate)

75+ members once again attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 

The Amazing Wine Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & (not-so) physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package. This hunt will also focus on Wine and participants will receive great Wine specials during our hunt.

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0130PM

What to expect: 


• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0130PM

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 


What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes.


What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Why does your RSVP say +40? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 


Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets here ASAP - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0130PM

Organizer`s phone number:[masked]


Wall Street Historic Tour is unusual walking path that brings you to some of the most important historical points in the history of America as lived in New York City. You will see the early settlement excavation which began in 1624 under the city’s original name- New Amsterdam. You will learn about the lifestyle and rules of the Dutch settlers. You will see Liberty Hall and visit George Washington’s personal pew in church, his favorite tavern, and visit Wall Street where across from the stock exchange, he was sworn in as the first president of the United States. Nearby, visit he first park in New York City and see the shrine of Ann Ellizabeth Seton,the first American Born Catholic canonized by a Romanian Pope. This tour includes such sightseeing as:

City Hall

Brooklyn Bridge

St. Paul Chapel

Trinity Church

Federal Hall and Charging Bull

Bowling Green Park

Elizabeth Seton Shrine

Frances Tavern

and more

Ticket is $10
results.how_to_find_us: In front of TD Bank 258 Broadway New York, NY, New York, NY

results.description:
Do you know Albertine ? Besides Proust's character, Albertine is a great bookshop and reading room within the French Embassy. I would be happy to help you choose a book in French to continue your practice. We will enjoy visiting that beautiful bookstore housed in the official landmark Payne Whitney mansion in Manhattan. Since 1952, the mansion has housed the Cultural Services of the French Embassy. Albertine’s ceiling – a hand-painted mural of constellations, stars, and planets — was modeled after the extraordinary ceiling of the music room at the Villa Stuck in Munich, Germany, crafted by Franz von Stuck [masked]).
Busts crafted by the ateliers of the Musée du Louvre of great figures from French and French-American culture including Voltaire, Benjamin Franklin, Tocqueville and Descartes are also on display.
The centerpiece of the entrance of the building is a replica of Michelangelo’s Young Archer. The original had been in the lobby of the mansion for decades until it was discovered to be a Michelangelo in 2009. It is supposively the only Michelangelo statue on American soil. It is currently on loan at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.


From here, we can go to the next block to enjoy the architecture of one of the most beautiful buildings in New York City : the Ukrainian Institute of America.

Across the street we can also visit the Met to see 10 of most appreciated pieces.

Le tout bien entendu, en francais !

NOTICE THAT :
-The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:30 PM.
-If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, just please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Merci !
In case my phone number is[masked]/[masked]
A bientôt !Alex
results.name: Albertine and more : books and art

75+ members once again attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 

The Amazing Wine Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & (not-so) physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package. This hunt will also focus on Wine and participants will receive great Wine specials during our hunt.

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0130PM

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

Some of the route and artists will be different from last year.

We won't be walking inside Green-Wood Cemetery. We are meeting on the public sidewalk (at the bench) on the southeast corner of 25th Street and 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, New York (before going inside the entrance to the cemetery) and then we'll be walking away from the cemetery.

Description: Park Slope Windsor Terrace Open Artist Studios has about 70 participating artists. These artists are opening their doors to the public and sharing their work. The artists don't charge admission to their art studios. We'll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view of the artists' working environment. We can also talk to the artists about what they do. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, and printmaking.

Below is titled "Irish Jig" by Janie Samuels.

Below is ceramic work by Caryn Kreitzer.

Below is titled "City Winter" by Tom Keough

Below is titled "Pavillion" by Dara Oshin.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is on the public sidewalk (at the bench) on the southeast corner of 25th Street and 5th Avenue., Brooklyn, NY. This is just outside of the short roadway that leads to the main gatehouse entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery. 

Below is outside of the entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery.

Before the walk, restrooms are available inside of Green-Wood Cemetery (Walk down the short roadway to the main gate entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery, go through the main cemetery gatehouse, make a right turn, and walk down the stone pathway to the low modern-style building with the wood doors.)

Transportation: Take the "R" subway train to 25th Street and 4th Avenue. THE "R" SUBWAY TRAIN IS A LOCAL TRAIN SO ALLOW EXTRA TIME. Then walk east one long block and meet on the public sidewalk (at the bench) on the southeast corner of 25th Street and 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, NY. (before going on Green-Wood Cemetery's property).

This is a one-way art walk so I suggest travelling to the meeting place by public transportation, not by car.

Finishing Time/Place: This one-way art walk will finish between 5:00 PM and 5:30 PM at the  subway station for the "R" train on Prospect Avenue and 4th Avenue. 

This walk is about 3 1/2 miles.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Only heavy rain will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.) If I do cancel the art walk, I also will post a cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

Below is by Phil DeSanti.

Below is titled "Botero" by Rich Garr.

Below is by Gerard Barbot.

Below is by Isabella Glaz. She said that her paintings are inspired by women's beauty, light, and colors.
results.name: Park Slope Windsor Terrace Artist Studio Walk (Nov. 7)

results.description:
Let's get together again at Eastside Billiards for more pool! The fun officially starts at 2pm with UNLIMITED play until 8 pm for only $20! Pay at the front desk and tell whomever is working the desk you're there for the meet up and they'll point you in our direction. All skill levels are welcome! I hope to see you there! Basic 8-Ball rules:

To avoid confusion and debate, here are some good rules for playing 8-ball. These are not the APA league rules, They're not "Mike's Biker bar" rules, they are the BCA rules which govern most pro pool matches.

-- The table is open (free choice of group) after the break, no matter which ball(s) are pocketed.
-- A scratch or other foul results in cue-ball in hand ANYWHERE on the table for the opponent.
-- Hitting one of your opponent's balls before one of your own on a shot is a foul.
-- Missing or scratching on the 8-ball is NOT loss of game if the 8-ball is still on the table.
-- The ball and pocket must be called unless the shot is obvious.
-- The number of cushions (or other balls) the ball bounces off need NOT be called.
-- The cue-ball or ANY other ball must touch a cushion or be pocketed after a shot or it's a foul.
-- The 8 ball must always be called.

results.description:
The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 


Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

<a href="https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst"></a>https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Humanity is starving for truth while it sits at a buffet of information & opportunities. The only way to feel fullness and abundance in every step of life is by unlocking the buffet of truth inside of you.  The key to unlocking your personal buffet of truth is found through mind, body, and soul integration. When the mind, body, and soul are integrated you feel enough, whole, and fulfilled, and all fear, pain, and struggle becomes a tool for never-ending growth and expansion.

How often do you feel enough, whole, & fulfilled?

Do you feel like your mind, body, and soul are working together at all times?

During this workshop, Yasmin and Tyler will teach you the art of mind, body, & soul integration that you can use to feel whole, full, and fulfilled as you share your unique gifts with the world.  Limiting beliefs, fear, pain, and doubt are all transformed into helpful tools for growth when your mind, body, & soul are integrated.

Brief Agenda:

1:45pm- Arrival and settling in

2:00pm- Stress relief meditation, chakra cleansing, & body healing with Yasmin

2:30-3:30pm – Connecting deeply with your mind, body, and soul for emotional healing and integration

3:30-4:00pm- Open discussion

4:00-5:00pm- Bringing your whole, enough, and fulfilled self to the “real world”

5:00-6:00pm- Q&A, What’s next for you? What’s next for us?

After party!??( Let’s nourish our bodies with amazing food!)

$45 paid in advance. Space is limited to only 20 people.

Free parking in the back of the Healing Zone (the towing signs do not apply to you) 



Public Transportation from NYC:


Go to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and take the Decamp bus #33 (New York to West Caldwell)

Get off at Broad Street and W Passaic ave. (There will be “Provident Bank” to your right and “Bloomfield Surgi Center” to your left at a traffic light. Walk down the right side on Broad st., the Healing Zone is next to Mario’s Pizza.

You can also go to www.NJTransit.com to plan out your trip from NY Penn to 1283 Broad St. Bloomfield, NJ

Bi-Perspective is the longest-running social, discussion and support group for ALL bisexual/non-monosexual, queer-identified and questioning people meeting in the New York City area.

Monthly meetings are held on the 1st Saturday of every month from 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM at the LGBT Community Center, followed by a convivial Coffee & Desert at a nearby local restaurant. The group provides a warm & friendly, welcoming, caring, SAFE, non-discriminatory environment for everyone who lives, works or plays in the New York City area.

Come visit and share your Feelings, Hopes and Dreams as well as your Fears, Concerns and Uncertainties with us. And of course, Joy and Laughter are always welcome at our meetings too! Bi-Perspective, a great way to meet others from the community and to make new friends in the New York area.

$5 (more if/less if) suggested donation to help defray room-rental cost

results.description:
Over the last thirty years, significant progress has been made in our understanding of the various types of memory, the neural processes of consolidation and reconsolidation, and the biochemistry of memory, as well as the malleability and limits of autobiographical memory. How might continued research help us identify the importance of memory in normal development, in terms of how our experience and recollection of it guides and affects our lives? What research directions are in development in the fight against memory impairment, an increasing concern for our long-living population? And what can memory researchers and scholars and practitioners of the art of memory learn from one another?

The Marianne & Nicholas Young Auditorium of
The New York Psychoanalytic Society & Institute 
247 East 82nd Street, NYC

Free and open to the public 
    Seating is on a first-come, first-serve basis
No registration required!

PARTICIPANTS:

  CRISTINA ALBERINI is Professor in the Center for Neural Science, New York University. She has been studying the biological mechanisms of long-term memory for the last 20 years. Her studies explore the biological mechanisms of memory consolidation and reconsolidation, the processes by which newly learned information become long-lasting memories, and how memories are modulated and integrated into complex behavioral manifestations. Her studies also aim at utilizing the basic understandings of the mechanisms of memory formation to enhance memories and prevent forgetting, or disrupt pathogenic memories. Both approaches have important translational applications.

She graduated from the University of Pavia in Italy with Honors and obtained a Doctorate in Research in Immunological Sciences from the University of Genoa in Italy. She trained as a post-doctoral fellow at Columbia University, studying the role of gene expression regulation during long-term synaptic plasticity consolidation in Aplysia californica. From 1997 to 2000, she served on the Faculty of Brown University before joining Mount Sinai in 2001 where she worked until 2011. In 2011 she joined the Center for Neural Science at NYU. She has received several awards including Hirschl-Weill Career Scientist Award, NARSAD Independent Investigator Award, McKnight Memory and Cognitive Disorder Award, Mount Sinai Dean’s Award for Excellence in Basic Science Research, Paul Harris Fellow -Rotary Club Cremona and NIMH-MERIT award.

Since 2004 she has been a member of the Council of the Molecular and Cellular Cognition Society (MCCS); she served as the society’s Treasurer from 2006 to 2009 and then as President from 2009 to 2012.

SVEN BERNECKER is Professor of Philosophy at the University of California, Irvine. After obtaining his doctorate in philosophy from Stanford University, he held research positions at the University of Munich, Birkbeck College London, the University of Manchester, and the University of Vienna. He is a recipient of a Humboldt Research Award, a Member of the Board of Directors of the American Philosophical Association, and Director of the Southern California Epistemology Network. His work is mainly in epistemology, philosophy of mind, metaphysics, Kant and German Idealism. He has published numerous articles in these areas and is the author of three books — Reading Epistemology (2006), The Metaphysics of Memory (2008), and Memory: A Philosophical Study (2010). Currently he is editing a Handbook of the Philosophy of Memory and working on a monograph on the metaphysical foundations of knowledge.
  TOM CAREW is the Anne and Joel Ehrenkranz Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Science at New York University, where he is also a Professor of Neural Science. Tom trained with Eric Kandel, a pioneer in the field of memory research. Tom is an elected fellow of both AAAS and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, and served as President of the Society for Neuroscience. His research interests center on cellular and molecular mechanisms of memory.
  MARTIN CONWAY is Professor of Cognitive Psychology, head of the psychology department at City University London. He has been studying human memory for more than thirty years. He is known for his pioneering theoretical work on autobiographical memory, as well as for his studies of the neuropsychology of memory and memory’s neurological basis. His research also includes memory impairment and enhancement, and he has recently explored the links between the ability of humans to remember past events and imagine future ones. A graduate of University College London, Dr. Conway earned a Ph.D. in psychology at Open University in 1984. He worked as post-doctoral research scientist in the Medical Research Council’s Applied Psychology Unit in Cambridge (UK) was later appointed lecturer in psychology at the University of Lancaster. He subsequently became professor and Chair of Psychology at the University of Bristol, Durham University, and the University of Leeds. A fellow of the Royal College of Arts, the British Psychological Society, the (UK) Academy of Social Sciences, the Psychonomic Society, and the American Psychological Association, he was awarded an honorary degree (Ph.D.) from the Université de Liège. He has been active in providing accessible accounts of research on memory to the public through radio and television, and has been involved in a variety of collaborations with artists that focus on memory. Dr. Conway has been an advisor in many legal cases and written extensively on memory and the law.

PENELOPE LEWIS is a neuroscientist at the University of Manchester, where  she runs the Neuroscience and Psychology of Sleep (NaPS) lab. Her research specifically investigates the role of sleep in strengthening and altering memories – and ways we can use this to our advantage. She is the author of The Secret World of Sleep, which has sold >10K copies and been translated into Japanese and Chinese. She recently gave a TEDx talk on sleep engineering which was viewed ~10K x in the first two months online. She has also written for popular science publications, including New Scientist, Scientific American, and BBC Focus, and was interviewed on NPR’s “Fresh Air”.  Her research has been featured on the BBC, and she’s received funding from top institutes, including a number of UK research councils as well as the Wellcome Trust and Unilever.

results.description:
You are invited on Saturday, November 7, 2015 at 2:30 PM to the Masonic Philosophical Society for our next hosted discussion and study. Each month a different topic, ranging from philosophy and science to religion and metaphysics, is discussed and debated. This group, which is open to the public, is where non-members can learn more about Freemasonry, as well as meet local Freemasons.

Study Topic
November's topic will be conducted by Brother Plinio Butten on a study of Freemasonry: Can reality be understood for what it is without being affected by individual perception? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Reality is a fluid concept and what we see as real is just a perception based on our beliefs and personality. The world we see is a reflection of who we are. Can reality be understood without being transformed into what we think it should be? is perception more important than reality? Is reality connected to perception and cannot be understood without being transformed into what we think it is? Freemasonry teaches the importance of being open to change and with that the opportunity to change our reality.

Directions:
[masked]th Ave Whitestone, NY 11357

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety

Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.co-masonry.org
results.name: Can reality be understood without being affected by individual perception?

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group.

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time.  

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice):

results.description:
Saturday, November 7, 2:30pm, 

Library Auditorium. 

The Baylor Massacre of the American Revolution. 

The 28th of September 1778 saw the bloodiest engagement to take place in Bergen County when the 3rd Continental Light Dragoons were attacked by British Infantry under General Charles Grey as they slept in farmers' barns at what is today River Vale. Later that day, militia men were dispatched from the American Camp at Old Paramus Church to offer whatever assistance they could but found only the bodies of slain troopers. Historian Ed Moderacki will talk about the Baylor Massacre, what happened to the dragoons and the eventual discovery of their remains.

Enjoy! 

Robet
results.name: The Baylor Massacre of the American Revolution.

results.description:
Kodo (Japanese Traditional Incense Ceremony) is a traditional amusement with history dating back to more than 1400 years ago. Kodo expresses its uniqueness by enjoying the scent through both literature and distinctive Japanese ancient culture. Due to its historical background, Kodo has long been closed to the public and is known to be a refined art played by the few chosen people within the upper class society

Hikaru O-mi became Iyemoto in 2000 for the family who has been practicing the art of incense for almost 1,400 years. He has mastered the art of incense, tea, flower arrangement and poem making by age 17. He will demonstrate and lecture on the art.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
Each of you have your very own "Yellow Brick Road," the path you walk on that you call your life. Unique in its own way, your current path is made up of everything that has made you... Your past, your stories, your experiences, your habits, your beliefs, your feelings, your thoughts. Simply, what you're living today, ALL of it, is a product of you. 

In the beautiful journey of life, your path can be smooth, flowing with blissful experiences, at the same time that it can be filled with roadblocks and barriers. But it's not just when there's a fork in the road that you must choose which way to go. The material that makes up the road is everything that's within you... and therefore the road you pave is always yours to choose. 

What within you have you transcended already to grow to who and where you are today? What within you do you still need to transform to take you to the next level, to live an even better version of that? 

What current life path are you on... and more importantly, what life path do you WANT to be living? 

I will tell you this much, the distance between those two are closer than you think. 

Come join us on Saturday afternoon to kickstart a very life-changing journey together where the "yellow brick road" you choose from here on is a golden, accelerated one. 

Please bring:


- A notebook and pen (if you wish)

- Water

- An open mind, an open heart, and a huge smile. :)

If you have any additional questions, please feel free to send me a message through meetup or email me at [masked]. I will happily & quickly respond.

I look forward to warmly welcoming each of you!

To Our Collective Success & With All My Love, 

Talia

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

results.description:
9v9 teams, 75min+ game. Arrive early and be ready to go on time at 2:15pm - Intermediate level.

All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!

****************************************************************

LOCATION:

Lower East Side, nr East River Park. 8-10 min walk from Delancey Street F train, head east along Houston, the field is south of Houston. Map here.

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, all players need to rotate in goal. Full size goals.

5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


All players must RSVP and make payment before game time, this goes toward  field permits, equipment, meetup & CC fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you pitch side!

Grand FC

results.description:
We're BACK! NPC's fall and final event for 2015 is an event encompassing womenpenuers, shopping and community support.


Our charity of choice is WIN NYC (women in need) a homeless shelter in New York City housing women and children that have escaped domestic violence and drug abuse.  For this event we will be providing much needed and tangible items to these women; clothes!


Part of the event will have a panel of four young, bright women that are claiming their passion and will be discussing their P.U.S.H (Pray Until Something Happens) moment. 

Tonya Rapley, founder, My Fab Finance & Social Entrepenuer

Candice Idehen, owner, Bed of Nails - Nail Bar™, celebrity nail artist

Annisa Mitchell aka Ilovealimara, Social Media Manager & Content Creator

Angela Walker, owner, N Salon; creator, Naturalista Hair Show and co-creator, Natural Hair Industry Convention

Moderator - Courtney Danielle aka CurlsandCouture, Social Media Influencer, co-creator, Black Girl Fly Magazine


We are also curating a holiday shopping experience with vendors selling amazing products and goodies for the naturalista and the fashionista. As the holiday season is close to the event date the vendors will be provided holiday gift sets and product specials! 


We will have passed appetizers and refreshments for all! 


Each attendee that provides one new article of clothing will get two chances to win one of the many amazing giveaways!


We are gifting all attendees with a special thank you swag bag that will have amazing products and discount cards and brochures. 

For tickets go to: www.npcholidaycheerncare.eventbrite.com

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at[masked].

This is the first Chelsea Best Exhibits Tour of the Season! If you are a novice or love art, our Chelsea Art Gallery Tours are a fun and casual way to explore a great part of the city while socializing and making new friends and connections.

With over 300 art galleries in Chelsea, our Gallery Tour  Led by Rafael Risemberg with a Ph.D. in arts education  finds the most innovative art, and leads you on an insightful, entertaining and affordable journey through the contemporary art scene.  Rafael explains the art in ways that makes the experience meaningful to those who don’t know a lot about art as well as those who do.

"We're excited to announce that his ALL-NEW tour will include the New York gallery scene's FIRST-EVER exhibit of virtual reality art, where you will wear a sophisticated headset attached to a computer and view extraordinary 3D animated images, unlike anything you've ever experienced!  This is just one of seven exceptional contemporary art exhibits on this tour."

Our tours take place RAIN, Snow or SHINE, as we’re indoors over 90% of the time. You will be amazed at how much you will learn and enjoy both the art and the people on the tour!

The group will meet at a local cafe prior to the tour.  Following the tour many from the group stay together for a drink or a bite to eat.

Pay $25 when you arrive

DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of the people come to this event on their own to meet new people and check out soe cool art.

What do I wear? Dress for the weather.  Be casual and comfortable.

What to expect: We are piggy backing on a larger tour.   We will have 10-15 from our group.  The age range for our people is 20's -40's ( the larger group is 20's - 60's)

How long does it last? about 2 hours

How do I know who is leading the group? We meet separate from the main tour at a local cafe.  Our tour host will have a sign at the bar and you will have a chance to have something to eat or drink before we start the tour.  If you are not hungry just socialize.  When we are finished we walk over together to join the main tour. 

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: NY's #1 Chelsea Art Gallery Best Exhibits Guided Tour: Socialize and Explore!

results.description:
In this transporting journey into 9th-century China, a general’s young daughter is abducted and raised as an assassin. After years of exile, she returns to her birthplace to kill the governor to whom she was once betrothed, only to find herself torn between personal passion and the assassin’s sacred code. With its breathless action set-pieces and vivid recreation of Tang Dynasty imperial life, Hou’s (The Flight of the Red Balloon) first-ever martial arts film offers a dazzling reimagination of the genre.

Best Director, Cannes Film Festival

Official selection: New York Film Festival

105 Minutes, In Mandarin with English subtitles

Taiwan/China/Hong Kong

http://www.ifccenter.com/films/the-assassin/


------------------------------

Movie time is 3:20.  I will be there by 3:00 or so and I look forward to seeing you. 


Note: As always, we will get a post movie drink to talk about the movie, talk about other movies and give me praise for setting this event up.  Since we will be at the IFC Center we will head over to Amity Hall a couple blocks away.  It is a great beer bar with good food. 


BUT.  Since we will be arriving around 5:30 and close to the start of NYC's weekend nightlife, it is not a definite that we will get seats or a table.  So it may be more informal.  Just bake that into your plans.   


-John
results.how_to_find_us: See my picture here.  I still look like that.  I will also have on a green gingham shirt.  That should narrow down the options.  I will be outside 20 minutes before.
results.name: The Assassin

results.description:
Come on down to the Colorado Cafe, New Jersey's premiere country dance club and sports bar.  This event usually sells out and is a night you won't want to miss!

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles (from this and its sister events - ages 35 - 49 & 45 - 59) that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes.  Plus after you've met all of your dates, you can be our guest (a $10 value) in the dance hall for a great night of country dancing.  There will be free dance lessons, a country dj, a live rock band in the sports bar and an amazing night for everyone!

It's sure to be a great night and we guarantee you'll meet someone you want to see again or your next event is on us!  So sign up soon because space is limited and advance registration at 8minuteDating.com is required.

Click here to register: http://www.8minutedating.com

My meetup group members can receive a $5 discount by entering promo code 8mdnynj5 in the appropriate space when registering at 8minuteDating.com!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the dance hall
results.name: 8minuteDating at the Colorado Cafe in Watchung

Dear Friends,

Enclosed are details for our next concert, scheduled for Saturday, November 7th, 2015:

OPENING COMMENTS

1.  Time on My Hands- V. Youmans, Meditation- A.C. Jobim: Dick LaVine (Concertina)

ACMA Concert Location Details:

DiMenna Center for Classical Music, Norman S. Benzaquen Hall (2nd Floor)
450 West 37th Street (between 9th and 10th Avenues), New York, NY 10018

If you have any questions regarding this event, please email me at [masked].

We will start as close to 4:00 p.m. as possible. Your punctuality is greatly appreciated.

Transportation

The DiMenna Center is conveniently located on 37th Street between 9th and 10th Avenues, within minutes of Port Authority, Penn Station, and Grand Central Station transportation hubs.

Subway:

A, C, E trains to 34th Street and 8th Avenue

1, 2, 3, LIRR trains to 34th Street and 7th Avenue

Bus:

N, R, Q, B, D, F, M trains to 34th Street and 6th Avenue

N, Q, R, S, 1, 2, 3, 7 trains to Times Square 42nd Street and 7th Avenue

M11 bus to 38th Street and 9th Avenue

M42 bus to 42nd Street and 10th Avenue

Contributions

We suggest a $5.00 contribution per person, to be directly applied towards payment of the hall rental. Contributions are voluntary, and any amount is greatly appreciated.

For Performers (Please read the Performance Tips page on the ACMA website):

What is the high point of your piece? Every musical and dramatic work takes its audience on a journey, generally consisting of the following elements:

1-) Introduction and elaboration: The central melodic theme is introduced and often repeated, in identical fashion or with variation. The mood of the piece is presented and established via use of dynamics, tempo and melodic arc.

The performer must draw in the audience at this point, either with a compelling narrative subtext, or strong emotional message. Also, the performer must build gradual tension (when applicable), leading the audience to the musical climax.

2-) Climax: The highest emotional point of the work, usually occurring 2/3 to ¾ into the piece. Requires maximum expression and melodic emphasis to evoke a desired reaction or response from the audience. Also considered a reward point, or tension release for the audience.

The performer should fully understand the climactic point of the piece, and clearly highlight this point via the use of tone, dynamic expression and musical touch. The importance of the climax for audience understanding and satisfaction cannot be underestimated.

3-) Resolution: The conclusion of the piece, during which all unresolved musical elements are resolved in a decisive manner.

The performer must prepare the audience for the eventual end of the musical journey, a return to reality. Musical cues which aid this transition include:

·  gradual decrescendo and diminuendo

·  a clear a decisive  end point , so as to not leave the audience with an uneasy feeling of something unresolved

Entertain your audience: Great entertainers (actors, singers, etc.) put their unique personality into every performance. If you want to make a memorable impression upon your audience, introduce a new, unique perspective on your piece. Once you truly own your piece, it should carry the inimitable stamp of your personality, but also sound as if it is being performed for the first time.

Select pieces that are personally meaningful to you, and allow for your maximum expression as both performer and entertainer.

Performances do not have to be memorized, or note-perfect. However, as a courtesy to your audience, please present a work that you have studied attentively, and can play to its completion.

If you make a mistake during your performance, please continue to play without stopping. Apologizing, repeating a previously played section, or stopping will only call more attention to your mistake.

Host: "Manhattan Lectures & Conversations" 

http://www.meetup.com/Manhattan-Lectures-Conversations/events/224596010/

This conversation is structured around the questions and answers in Pat Love, Ph.D. and Jon Carlson, Ph.D.'s TV Series "LOVE: What Everyone Need to Know" shown on CUNY TV every Tuesday at 10PM, TV Channel 25-3. 

http://www.cuny.tv/show/love/PR1010105

We will be watching the episode "Cross Cultural Look at Love and Relationships" together and discussing the points made in the show after.

Bring your questions and your collective wisdom.

About the CUNY TV series, "Love:  What Everyone Needs to Know."


"According to psychologists, the single greatest predictor of happiness and success in life is a healthy love relationship. Yet, although we concede that knowledge is power, most of us have only a rudimentary understanding of what we’re in for when we go off in search of true love.

LOVE demystifies this all-important predictor of happiness, defining the nature of true love and outlining the commitment it takes to keep it alive. This telecourse is taught by two distinguished doctors: Dr. Pat Love, a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and relationship consultant, and Dr. Jon Carlson, a university professor and Psychologist. Both instructors are practicing clinicians and have authored books and articles that have attracted national recognition. They challenge students to confront assumptions on the nature of love and to critically analyze the ideals perpetuated by popular culture in order to realize the wisdom it takes to find lasting love."

Suggestions:

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment.

B. Make one point at a time and allow others respond. Speak from personal experience.

C. Identify the underlying assumptions. Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

Participants are:

- expected to honor other people's stated boundaries and respect their privacy
- not obligated to provide information or answer any questions against their will
- encouraged to share only information they feel comfortable with sharing
- expected to maintain confidentiality and not reshare personal information without permission from the owner.


Please be advised that meetup is NOT a forum for dating, proselytizing, therapy, or for employees or independent contractors to introduce, promote, or sell goods and/or services, or for any unlawful activity. Participants voluntarily agree to participate by showing up. Thank you.

In June, we had our first yoga meetup with Dynesha Henderson, owner of NESH BK. Now, we'll be gathering at Brooklyn Wine Yard in Bed-Stuy for a night of wine, yoga and more to support and celebrate NESH BK's 1st Annual Benefit on November 7 from 4-8pm.

YOGA * LOCAL ARTIST * FOOD * DRINK SPECIALS * RAFFLE * SWAG BAGS * GIVE AWAYS * MUSIC

Suggested donation of $20 at the door gets you the following:

Wrist band options (5pm – 8pm)
– Wine tasting $20
– Bottomless Beer pitchers $20
– Food and Drink Specials
– Free Yoga class

You're encouraged to RSVP here for a swag bag: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1tokQwLSPAdGKjCGePqi56bUUEhzQRwqzxxBFCz_uDnk/viewform?usp=send_form

Schedule of Events
4:00 pm – 5:00 pm Yoga session (back patio **please note, space is limited and will be first come, first serve**)
5:00 pm – 5:30 pm Reading by local artist Milton Washington (back room)
5:35 pm – 5:50 pm NESH non-profit presentation and raffle (back room)
6:00 pm – 8:00pm  Music, Mingle, and Swag Bag Giveaways

Local Artist Milton Washington 
A fatherless black boy was born to a Korean Prostitute a decade and-a-half after the Korean War. Left to roam his camp town with a pack of homeless kids, little Milton-ah fights, steals and drinks while his mother works long hours. All until the age of 8, when he’s adopted from the country that never claimed him, by a black military family from Texas, the Washington’s.

Slickyboy is about the love and loss of one mother, and the finding of another, with a lifetime of living in between.

Please note our No-Show policy: Please honor your “Yes” RSVPs by attending.  If you’re not able to attend, please be considerate to your fellow group members, the business owners, and me, and update your RSVP at least 1 day before the scheduled start of the meetup.  If you don’t show, or cancel your RSVP the same day of the event 3 times, you’ll be removed from the group.

Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

The room and staff have agreed to work with us and we are officially given the weekend space for our events.

I look forward to seeing more and more of you each time we have an event and soon we will be offering tarot classes and witchcraft lessons for the many people who have asked me for them. Please sign up for November asap so we can get an accurate count and provide the number of tables necessary.

Psychic/tarot readings will be available by myself and Lady Foxglove if you need one.


There is food and beverages (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) available for purchase if you desire.
If you require more information, just email me at [masked]. Thank you.

Till we merry meet again,
Lady Morgana Avallone, HPS/Organizer

results.description:
Join us on Nov. 7th, 2015 when Adventures in Photography visits the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine to photograph this iconic structure which is the fourth largest Christian Church in the world.

AIP has arranged for private access to this site. The entire space will be open and accessible to our group including the triforium level in the main hall. (There is about a 50 stair climb to the triforium.)

Our group will be allowed to use tripods and/or monopods. However, we need to collapse them on our climb to the triforium.

There is local street parking and several parking garages very close to the Cathedral. If possible, we will arrange for car pools in order to share in parking and travel expenses. 

We are limiting the size of the group to 12 photographers plus AIP Organizers to maximize our photo ops and avoid having other photographers in our line of sight.

______________________________________________

The Cathedral of St. John the Devine, is the cathedral of the Episcopal Diocese of New York. It is located on Amsterdam Avenue between West 110th Street and 113th Street in Manhattan's Morningside Heights.

The Cathedral was designed in 1888 and construction began in 1892. It remains unfinished, with construction and restoration a continuing process.

The following images of the interior of the Cathedral will give you an idea of what you'll find to photograph on Nov. 7th, 2015.

_____________________________________________

The following images of the Cathedral of St. John the Devine will give you a good idea of what you expect to find and photograph on Nov. 7th, 2015


We hope you can join us.

Martin Joffe, Eric Dong, Boris Hardouin-Deleuze and Shiv Verma

Your AIP Organizers

results.description:
Hola amigas y amigos!

Join us for the movie Captain Pantoja (and the special services)! It will be an  afternoon of fun, entertainment and mucho, mucho español.

This movie was based on the comedic novel Captain Pantoja and the Special Service (Spanish: Pantaleón y las visitadoras) by Nobel Laureate writer from Peru Mario Vargas Llosa. The Peruvian army captain Pantaleon Pantoja, a very serious and efficient officer, is chosen by his superiors to set up a special service of 'visitors' to satisfy the special needs of the soldiers posted on remote jungle outposts. He uses his remarkable organizational skills in action and in a short time has his female squad running smoothly.

 The Los Angeles Times called Captain Pantoja "A sure-fire mix of sex and satire". 

IN SPANISH, WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES - SUITABLE FOR ALL LEVELS

REFRESEHMENTS WILL BE SERVED!!!

WHERE

At EASY ESPANOL, located on the 11th floor (address is at the top). Can't miss it.

EVENT SCHEDULE

Saturday, November 7th, 2015

5:30 pm: Door opens, arrive in venue. Meet others and practice your Spanish!

5:40 pm: A brief intro to the movie

5:45 pm: Movie starts!

7:20 pm: Movie ends

7:20 - 7:30 pm: Short discussion afterwards

ABOUT THE FILM

Captain Pantoja and the Special Services (2000) "Pantaleón y las visitadoras" (original title) R, 137 min, Comedy, Drama, 27 September 2002 (USA)  7.2  / 10 Rating.

Director: Francisco J. Lombardi

Writers: Enrique Moncloa, Giovanna Pollarolo, 1 more credit »

Stars: Angie Cepeda, Salvador del Solar, Mónica Sánchez

COST

Just $6 online or  $10 at event (if space is available)

SPACE IS LIMITED; PLEASE PAY ONLINE IN ADVANCE TO SECURE (RESERVE) A SPOT. RSVPs without payment DO NOT reserve seats.

Advance payment will guarantee (reserve) a spot. You can also pay cash $10 at event if space is available.

No PayPal? No credit card? No problem. Please read ---> HERE

Read about Payment Confirmations ---> HERE

IMPORTANT NOTES
1) CANCELLATIONS/Event changes: Read ---> HERE
2) Please turn off your cell phone/beeper when movie starts
3) NO NEED TO BRING A PRINTED COPY of your online payment - But it might help if you do. Anyone who paid online will be in a list at the door under his/her paypal accountholder name or the name on the credit card (whichever was used to pay)

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
The Light The Night Walk is a fundraising campaign benefiting The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) and their funding of research to find blood cancer cures. 

This wonderful organization needs volunteers to help along the walk route in Rye, NY.  Volunteers will be directing walkers through our “Hall of Heroes” and “Section of Silence” sections of the walk and ensuring these sections remain properly set up throughout the duration of the walk.  We will also be cheering and directing walkers along the walk route and handing out "mission moments" at the Finish Line.  We need MANY enthusiastic volunteers in this area from 5:30pm-8:30pm!

*Note* - This event has numerous other volunteer opportunities starting around 3:30pm...if you would like to volunteer in a different area prior to the route activies, please feel free to contact me directly.  I will be there earlier helping out.  =)

* Please add +1's to your RSVP if you are bringing kids! 


The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Light The Night® Walk funds research to find cures and ensure access to treatments for all blood cancer patients.  More info can be found here:   http://www.lightthenight.org/

Today we will be focused and immersive in a  specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will focus on drawing characters or machines from the futuritic Victorian world of Steampunk.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also if you'd like to share any art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them.

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 36-48 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

results.description:
100 RSVP's across Meetup and Facebook platforms! 

Our last event was truly special! We filled up the space with lovely singles ready to mix & mingle! 

How would you like to go on 20+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates. 

Speed Dating seats sell out quickly - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E

Our last event sold out fast! And now I have a long wait-list for speed dating. Sign up today, you won't regret it! (There is no selling out for mingling, only speed dating seats)

ATTENTION: Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP! Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials.

 Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network! 

$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

Preregister now by clicking here!!
*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*


$5.00 cover to attend mixer only
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?!

 Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a sexy and grown FUN time! 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials!
$7.00 Beer!!
$25.00 Hookah!!!
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

How it works: 

• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants.
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN!
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!

results.description:
Getting excited for New York's print week? Visit us on Saturday, November 7th from 6:00 - 9:00 pm for the 2015 New York International Miniature Print Exhibition, juried by Sarah Suzuki, Curator of Prints, Drawings, and Illustrated Books at MoMA. More than 200 prints will be on display in the gallery as well as 6 full binders of work. All for sale!

This event is part of NYC Print Week. Exhibition will be on view in the MGC Gallery from November 1 through December 18.

For more information about NYC Print Week activities: http://www.ifpda.org/content/print-fair/print-week
